education_text.0: Manfred Klaus Warmuth is a computer scientist known for his pioneering research in      Computational learning theory computational learning theoryManfred Klaus Warmuth is a computer scientist known for his pioneering research in      Computational learning theory computational learning theoryAfter postdoctoral research at the      University of California, Berkeley University of California, Berkeley and      Hebrew University of Jerusalem Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Warmuth joined the      University of California, Santa Cruz University of California, Santa Cruz in 1983, became Distinguished Professor there in 2017, and retired as a professor emeritus in 2018After postdoctoral research at the      University of California, Berkeley University of California, Berkeley and      Hebrew University of Jerusalem Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Warmuth joined the      University of California, Santa Cruz University of California, Santa Cruz in 1983, became Distinguished Professor there in 2017, and retired as a professor emeritus in 2018After postdoctoral research at the      University of California, Berkeley University of California, Berkeley and      Hebrew University of Jerusalem Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Warmuth joined the      University of California, Santa Cruz University of California, Santa Cruz in 1983, became Distinguished Professor there in 2017, and retired as a professor emeritus in 2018With his student Nick Littlestone,          Warmuth published the      redirect    Weighted majority algorithm weighted majority algorithm for combining the results for multiple predictors in 1989
